title: Portfolio
text:
Portfolio





Elevate your data with visuals that captivate and communicate. Whether you need striking graphics, custom reporting tools, or seamless back-end solutions, discover a range of services designed to turn your data into compelling stories and functional insights.






Captivating visuals

title: Let visuals simplify your data story.
text:
Let visuals simplify your data story.


Creating compelling data visuals that transform complex information into clear, actionable insights. From dynamic dashboards to custom ad-hoc visuals and reporting templates, I deliver solutions that make it easy for audiences to understand their data, empowering informed decisions and driving impactful results.

 Get in touch 














Visualization


Unlock the power of your data with engaging visuals and interactive dashboards that make insights clear and actionable.




Business Intelligence


Drive smarter decisions with tailored BI solutions that reveal key trends and strategic opportunities.




Engineering & Pipelines


Streamline your data processes with efficient pipelines and engineering solutions that ensure accuracy and reliability.

title: Ford Johnson
text:
GitHub
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  

  
  


Hey there, I’m Ford, a data analyst and storyteller with experience navigating the intersection of web analytics and big data. I’m skilled at untangling complex datasets to find useful insights and telling engaging stories with the data.
Beyond the digital realm, you’ll often find me exploring the great outdoors, capturing moments through the lens of my camera, or embarking on hiking adventures.
Feel free to explore my work on this site, where I share insights, projects, and a glimpse into my data journey.

title: Ford Johnson
text:
binom.test(13, 14, 1/2, alternative = "greater")


    Exact binomial test

data:  13 and 14
number of successes = 13, number of trials = 14, p-value = 0.0009155
alternative hypothesis: true probability of success is greater than 0.5
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.7032658 1.0000000
sample estimates:
probability of success 
             0.9285714 



library(ggplot2)
library(showtext)

Loading required package: sysfonts


Loading required package: showtextdb

library(ggtext)

Warning: package 'ggtext' was built under R version 4.4.1

showtext_auto()
showtext_opts(dpi = 300)

font_add_google(name = "Roboto", family = "Roboto")
font_1 <- "Roboto"

n <- 14 
p <- 1/2  
x_obs <- 12  

binom_test <- binom.test(x_obs, n, p, alternative = "greater")

p_value <- binom_test$p.value
conf_int <- binom_test$conf.int

p_ge_x_obs <- sum(dbinom(x_obs:n, size = n, prob = p))

data <- data.frame(
  x = 0:n,
  probability = dbinom(0:n, size = n, prob = p),
  color = ifelse(0:n >= x_obs, "#C0392B", "#30394F")  
)

ggplot(data, aes(x = x, y = probability, fill = color)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", alpha = 0.7) +
  scale_fill_identity() +  
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = 0:n) +  
  labs(
    title = "Binomial Distribution (n = 14, p = 0.5)",
    x = "Number of Successes",
    y = "Probability"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(),
    plot.margin = margin(10, 10, 10, 10),
    axis.text = element_text(family = font_1, size = 9),
    axis.title = element_text(family = font_1, size = 9),
    axis.title.x = element_text(margin = margin(5, 0, 0, 0, 'mm')),
    axis.title.y = element_text(margin = margin(0, 5, 0, 0, 'mm')),
    plot.title = element_text(family = font_1, size = 12),
  ) +
  annotate(
    geom = 'richtext',
    x = n,
    y = max(data$probability) * 0.9,
    label = paste0(
      "<span style='color:#C0392B; font-size:9pt;font-family:Roboto;'>",
      "Successes = ", x_obs, "<br>",
      "P(X ≥ ", x_obs, ") = ", round(p_ge_x_obs, 4), "<br>",
      "95% CI = [", round(conf_int[1], 4), ", ", round(conf_int[2], 4), "]</span>"
    ),
    hjust = 1, fill = NA, label.color = NA
)
